mysql

Class DBConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • mysql.DBConnection
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DBcategorizer, DBcrawler, DBgui

    public abstract class DBConnection
extends java.lang.Object
    class to connect to a MySQL database
    Author:
    Holger Ebhart

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.sql.Connection c
      the connection to the database
      protected java.text.DateFormat dateFormat
      formatter to format a date for the database
      protected java.util.logging.Logger logger
      a logger to log warnings, exceptions and informations
      protected boolean runningRequest
      boolean to indicate a running database-request

    • Constructor Detail

      • DBConnection

        public DBConnection(AccessData accessData,
            java.util.logging.Logger logger)
             throws java.lang.InstantiationException,
                    java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                    java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        configure the connection to the database
        Parameters:
        accessData - the access data to the specified mysql-database as AccessData
        logger - a global logger for the whole program as Logger
        Throws:
        java.lang.InstantiationException - thrown if the mysql-driver hasn't been found
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - thrown if the mysql-driver hasn't been found
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - thrown if the mysql-driver hasn't been found

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public void connect()
             throws java.sql.SQLException
        starts the connection to the database
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - thrown if there is no connection to the database possible

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        cuts the connection to the database off

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        returns true if a database-connection is established, false if there's no database-connection
        Returns:
        true if a database-connection is established, false if there's no database-connection

      • executeStatementUpdate

        protected boolean executeStatementUpdate(java.sql.PreparedStatement stmt,
                             boolean resultNotNull)
        executes the update method of a PreparedStatement
        Parameters:
        stmt - the statement to execute as update as PreparedStatement
        resultNotNull - true if the result should be != 0, false if the result should be >= 0
        Returns:
        true if the update on the database was successfully, else false

      • closeResultAndStatement

        protected void closeResultAndStatement(java.sql.Statement stmt,
                           java.sql.ResultSet result)
        closes a Statement and it's result
        Parameters:
        stmt - the statement to close as Statement
        result - the result to close as ResultSet

      • sqlExceptionLog

        protected void sqlExceptionLog(java.sql.SQLException e)
        logs an SQLException

      • sqlExceptionResultLog

        protected void sqlExceptionResultLog(java.sql.SQLException e)
        logs an SQLException that has been thrown by reading the resultset
        Parameters:
        e - the SQLException to log

      • sqlExceptionLog

        protected void sqlExceptionLog(java.sql.SQLException e,
                   java.sql.Statement statement)
        logs an SQLException with the responsible statement
        Parameters:
        e - the SQLException to log
        statement - the statement that causes the exception as Statement
